result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan T Mooney #177854 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Veh. Use-Control. Substance, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay for ticket for witness who was flown back to WI for trial date.
Maintain GFE at fulltime employment or fulltime school, and when not fully engaged complet 10 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.
No possession of drugs, unless has valid prescription.
No contact w/ victim's family except if victim's family is interested in future to have restorative justice.

Cooperate w/ rules and regulations from DOC.
Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

supervisions.notes: Not able to operate a motor vehicle until a valid DL is obtained and then only under supervision of agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called 10:51 am.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears in custody, pro se.  Victim's family members are also present.  
All present parties appear via Zoom/telephone. 

Date and Time set for Sentence Adjustment Review;  VRCW.

The State is objecting to the Sentencing Adjustment. 
Defendant is scheduled to be released in May of 2022. 
Defendant makes statements and addresses the family.

State is opposed to the modification and makes argument. 

Daughter of victim makes statement.
Another family member makes statement. 

Defendant makes final statement.
Court makes findings. 
Court DENIES defendant's Sentence Modification request.

IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Dennis Schertz is relieved of any further representation of Evan Mooney in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 8:43am
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Wallace

State addresses PSI report with COMPAS assessment and asks court not to consider anything from COMPAS assessment
Atty Wallace has no stance on COMPAS assessment
COURT will not consider or rely on COMPAS assessment

R.G. gives statement
R.C. gives statement
R.C. reads written statement on behalf of J.N.
K.K. gives statement
J. F. gives statement
C.C. reads written statement on behalf of L.C. 
I.G. reads written statement on behalf of D.G.
I. G. gives statement
L.C. reads written statement on behalf of V.D.
L.C. gives statement
T.D. gives statement

State gives argument to sentencing
Atty Wallace gives argument to sentencing
Defendant gives statement
COURT makes findings
Atty Wallace makes counterargument regarding deft consumption of Delta 9-THC drug use
State makes counterargument regarding drug effects of Delta 9-THC
COURT addresses deft drug abuse issues

COURT ORDERS: 18 years WSPS, 8 years initial confinement, 10 years extended supervision.
CONDITIONS: Cooperation with rules and regulations from department of corrections. Complete any assessement, treatment, or counseling as deemed necessary by agent. AODA assessment with follow up. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, including no contact with bars or taverns, no possession of drugs, unless by valid perscription. No contact with victims family, except if victims family is interested in the future to have restorative justice. 5 years drivers license revoked, not able to operate motor vehicle until obtains valid drivers license and then does so under supervision of agent. Maintain GFE in full time work or full time school, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service per week. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Pay CC plus $483.20 for airplane ticket for witness who was flown back to Wisconsin for trial date. 515 days jail credit given.

Deft is remanded to MCJ to be transported to Dodge County
